WRITING.TEXT: Instead of joining a church look for local charity groups that are non-secular. More often than not religious based charities push their message alongside their free meals.

That is true.
Atheist's don't base their morals on their atheism though. Atheism is the rejection of a god claim and nothing else. If an atheist hates gay people it's because he's come to that conclusion for some, albeit most likely unfounded, reason. Where as the religious get their morals from an ancient text book that explicitly tells them to kill gay people. If they do it or not it's still repugnant that anyone would insist religion is for the morally virtuous.
The real harm of religion can be more easily seen in Africa, where missionaries have given uneducated locals the bible instead of food and resource education and now we have active groups of militia men who kill anyone who is found to be gay or breaking "god's law."
You think the gay men being rounded up in Chechnya is just because of a little bit of personal bigotry? I'm willing to bet it has it's base in a religious influence.
As a personal aside, any book that would advocate the stoning of men, women, and children (looking at you the Bible and the Koran) for petty minor "sins" that is found throughout human nature is a book not only worth disregarding but also disposing of.
No exclusive good has ever come of religion that could be achieved by non-secular means. Religion is belief in the unfounded and it's easy to dupe the gullible into doing horrible things with it's claims.
I stand by my statement firm and strong. Fuck religion.

Regardless of the good works they do do they believe in their own doctrine and follow it's edicts? It's wonderful they help people but it doesn't mean the things they believe aren't morally bankrupt.
Regardless of whether they are doing good or not the beliefs at the core of the system are twisted as can be. They can feed the homeless one day and then preach hate the next, that is the cycle of religion.
They could just as easily feed the poor without the pretense of religion for doing so, so it being a church is irrelevant to the good works they do.

I'm the poster who will disparage all religions.
They are archaic and often barbaric remnants of the past that only the weak willed and feeble minded cling to. Basically, if you can't think for yourself join a religion. If you're a terrible human being with no empathy for others, join a religion.
You may think you're different "Well I don't hate like all the other Christians/Muslims/Etc." but you're still supporting a religion based on the most vile and brutal laws man kind has ever seen, a religion with no real backing or evidence to prove it's even true.
Religion is designed to keep the poor poor and the stupid stupid while benefiting those on the top who full well understand what a big scam it all is but still push forward to empty the pockets of their followers in the name of their god.
It's sickening and in my opinion is never justified. Show me one demonstrable thing that you can get with religion and no where else and you'll have a reason to be religious...but no one can. Religion is useless and I for one can't wait to see it disappear into the dark chapters of humanities history.

Just because 60's sell more for having a better average roll doesn't mean that 60's are the best availible. That is my point the 63's that are being sold are going to be better than the 60's of the same quality because they had higher rolls. Just because mostly good 60's were sold doesn't make the statement "More often than not the best items in the AH were ilvl 60" true. The good rolled 63's are always better and were...and super duper expensive.
I'll agree most people rolled with 60's because of Act I farming but that doesn't mean there weren't 63's on the AH that had better stats. If there was that makes the 63's the best items on the AH by fact.
We're in full agreement except for the statement "the best items on the AH were often ilvl 60" because as long as a better ilvl 63 item was there they were not the best items, just the best AND affordable items.

I played hundreds of hours at release and no...ilvl 63 was ALWAYS the go to. You could have a good 60 but if you went to the AH 63's were always available and way outclassed the 60's.
I think you mean the best and affordable were often ilvl 60.

so the best items on the AH were more often than not ilvl 60 items!
You originally said the best items were ilvl 60 and you're wrong, ilvl63 had the best stat ranges. Just because there were more ilvl60 doesn't mean 60's on average were better than 63's just because there were more of them.
I get that you're just trying to say you'd find more 60's than not but it doesn't make your statement of them being better true at all.

All of that just raises more questions.
If God is unable to prevent evil, then he is not all-powerful. If God is not willing to prevent evil, then he is not all-good. If God is both willing and able to prevent evil, then why does evil exist?
Trilemma by early skeptics.
I don't think God truly grants people free will. It's "believe in me or go to hell."
If I came to your house and held a gun to you and said, "Worship me and give me all your wordly possessions because I am a god." would you do it? It's not free will if I'm threatening you. With the Christian god it's much worse...an eternity of torture.
Why would god have to weep for the evil on earth? He made everything that exists according to your theology so he must of made evil too right? Is anything in this world NOT to his design?
And how does the removal of free will cause our fabric to fall apart? It's already debatable if we have free will as we currently understand it, so that is a claim without any backing that needs a lot of clarification.
